summary.p: A complete copy of the Tirukkuṟaḷ, text with the commentary by Parimēlaḻakar, preceded by a satellite stanza.
Description by Eva Wilden based on the digital images available on Gallica.
Original manuscript examined by Emmanuel Francis (October 2022).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

collation.desc: 1 folio = Title Page. No foliation. Verso blank. 440 x 35 mm.
3 folios = Tirukkuṟaḷ: Table of Contents. Tamil foliation {1}, 2-3 and parallel Arabic foliation {1}, 2-3. 435 x 35 mm.
375 folios = Tirukkuṟaḷ: Text & Commentary. Tamil foliation 1-375. Parallel Arabic foliation 1-375. f375v blank. 440 x 35 mm.
2 folios = back guard leaves. No foliation. Blank recto verso. 440 x 35 mm.

handNote.desc: Hand #1. Ducler's scribe. Traditional script with modern ṟa.

The number is that found in the catalogue of Velanguani Arokium (1845).
BnF current shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 51 (front cover, recto). Covering an older sticker.

List of chapters (entitled tiruvaḷḷuvanāyaṉār kuṟal uraipāṭam Atikāra Aṭṭavaṉai; 4 columns): chapter's name followed by its folio number; total chapters (atikāram), total subsections (iyal), total stanzas (kuṟaḷ). See details below.

binding.p: Original brown wood covers. 440 x 35 mm.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Dated to circa 1830 by Vinson (1868) and to 1830 by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds (presumably Ducler's provenance). By Ducler's scribe, working around 1830. Probably not before 1828 (date of the earliest internally dated Ducler's manuscript). Not later than its first mention (Burnouf 1832).

provenance.p: Copied for Philippe Ducler by an unnamed copyist in Karaikal Jail. See Burnouf (1832).

acquisition.p: Acquired, July 22nd, 1833, from Philippe Ducler. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 1 = Acquisitions: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1833-1848, no. 84.

Burnouf, Eugène. 1832. Rapport fait au Conseil, dans la séance du 2 juillet 1832, sur les collections de manuscrits et de dessins rapportées de l’Inde par M. Ducler, administrateur de Carical, membre de la Société asiatique. Journal asiatique 10, p. 84-87. — See p. 90, n° 28.
Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 11, no. 51.
Velanguani Arokium [Vēḷāṅkaṇṇi Ārōkkiyam]. 1845. Catalogue des manuscrits tamouls de la Bibliothèque royale. BnF NAF 5443. — See p. 11, no. 11.
Vinson, Julien & Feer, Léon & s.n. 1866-. Catalogue des manuscrits tamoul et télinga. Manuscript, BnF Indien 577. — See f. 17r, no. 51.

Vinson, Julien. 1868. Manuscrits tamouls. Proofreadings of the catalogue for Tamoul 1-204 (old shelfmark). Printed by the atelier oriental de l’Imprimerie nationale. BnF “4-IMPROR-77 (B)”. — The same proofreadings with black ink handwritten corrections are found in Vinson et al. (1866-, f1-f49). — See p. 17, no. 51.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
